meanings.definition: To put an end to; crush
meanings.sent1: The hero scotched the evil plan of the villain.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters scotched the raging flames before they could spread.
meanings.sent3: The clever detective scotched the criminal's escape with a clever trap.
meanings.sent4: The teacher scotched the rumors of a pop quiz by announcing a movie day instead.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight scotched the dragon's reign of terror with a swift strike of his sword.
